definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To provide with a tip; to cover the tip of. [from 15th c.]

main_definition: ( transitive ) To provide with a tip; to cover the tip of. [from 15th c.]

definitions.definition: ( ergative ) (To cause) to become knocked over, fall down or overturn . [(transitive) From early 14th c.] [(intransitive) From earlier 16th c.]
( ergative ) (To cause) to be, or come to be, in a tilted or sloping position; (to cause) to become unbalanced . [from 17th c.]
To cause the contents of a container to be emptied out by tilting it.
( transitive , slang , dated ) To drink . [from 18th c.]
( US , transitive ) To pour a libation or a liquid from a container, particularly from a forty of malt liquor . [from 20th c.]
( transitive ) To deflect with one′s fingers, especially one′s fingertips .

main_definition: ( ergative ) (To cause) to become knocked over, fall down or overturn . [(transitive) From early 14th c.] [(intransitive) From earlier 16th c.]
secondary_definitions: ( ergative ) (To cause) to be, or come to be, in a tilted or sloping position; (to cause) to become unbalanced . [from 17th c.]
To cause the contents of a container to be emptied out by tilting it.
( transitive , slang , dated ) To drink . [from 18th c.]
( US , transitive ) To pour a libation or a liquid from a container, particularly from a forty of malt liquor . [from 20th c.]
( transitive ) To deflect with one′s fingers, especially one′s fingertips .

definitions.definition: ( now rare ) To hit quickly and lightly; to tap . [from late 15th c.]

main_definition: ( now rare ) To hit quickly and lightly; to tap . [from late 15th c.]

definitions.definition: To give a small gratuity to, especially to an employee of someone who provides a service. [from early 18th c.]
examples: You should always tip your waiter in the United States and most third world countries.

definitions.definition: ( thieves' cant ) To give , pass . [from early 17th c.]

main_definition: To give a small gratuity to, especially to an employee of someone who provides a service. [from early 18th c.]
secondary_definitions: ( thieves' cant ) To give , pass . [from early 17th c.]

definitions.definition: To give a piece of private information to; to inform (someone) of a clue, secret knowledge, etc.
To enter a prediction of the winning team of a football game, as part of a footy tipping competition.
To predict something having a particular outcome.

main_definition: To give a piece of private information to; to inform (someone) of a clue, secret knowledge, etc. [from late 19th c.]
secondary_definitions: ( Australia ) To enter a prediction of the winning team of a football game, as part of a footy tipping competition.
( Australia ) To predict something having a particular outcome.
